Full Paragraph Text: Through continuous innovation and renovation of our food and beverages portfolio we are able to offer people healthier and tastier choices at every stage of their life, at any time of the day. Science-based innovation enables us to enhance the quality of people’s diets, using our knowledge and our research and development capability to make a positive contribution to society. Wherever you are in the world, we have safe, nutritious products to help you care for yourself and your family. A few years ago, we expanded the boundaries of Nutrition, Health and Wellness with the creation of Nestlé Health Science, motivated by the opportunity to forge a major therapeutic role for nutrition in the management of health. In line with this broadened strategy, in 2014 the Board approved the sale of 48.5 million L’Oréal shares to L’Oréal for cancellation. Part of the proceeds were used for the acquisition of the 50% stake in our joint venture Galderma from L’Oréal, bringing our ownership of Galderma to 100%. Galderma formed the foundation of a new Nestlé subsidiary, Nestlé Skin Health. Its goal is to be recognised as the leading company in skin health, offering science-based solutions to protect, nourish and enhance skin, and where needed to treat, correct and restore damaged skin over the course of people’s lives. Nestlé Skin Health provides prescription drugs, self-medication, therapeutic skin care and aesthetic and corrective medicine, allowing us to compete in the growing and promising multi-billion global skincare market. Nestlé Skin Health was further strengthened by the acquisition of the full rights to commercialise several key aesthetic dermatology products in the United States and Canada.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Individual: People, families, and individuals who consume products and receive health benefits from Nestlé's offerings; Organizational: Nestlé as a company developing products, making strategic decisions, and creating subsidiaries like Nestlé Health Science and Nestlé Skin Health
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé's innovation and product development enhances people's diets and provides health solutions to individuals and families.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes how Nestlé (Organizational) develops and offers products that directly benefit people's health and nutrition (Individual). The company's strategic decisions, R&D capabilities, and product portfolio creation causally influence individual health outcomes and dietary quality.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé and its units (Nestlé Health Science, Nestlé Skin Health) take actions (innovation, product provision).; Individual: People/consumers/families whose diets and self-care are affected by the products and innovations.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé’s innovation and products causally improve people’s diet quality and ability to care for themselves.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states organizational actions improve individuals’ diets and self-care. Other potential links (to society or markets) were excluded to keep within the scale limit and avoid weaker inferences.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Individual: The text discusses how products benefit people and families, indicating a focus on individual health.; Organizational: Nestlé and its subsidiaries are mentioned as organizations driving innovation and product offerings.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé's innovations in health and wellness directly benefit individuals by providing healthier choices and skin health solutions.
o4_mini: Rationale: The links demonstrate how Nestlé's organizational actions, such as product innovation and acquisitions, lead to improved health outcomes for individuals. The focus remains on these two scales, as they clearly illustrate the causal relationships present in the text.
gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Individual | Organizational -> Individual | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal | Organizational -> Individual | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'people', 'people’s diets', 'yourself and your family', and 'people’s lives' as direct recipients or beneficiaries of products/services.; Organizational: Refers to 'we' (Nestlé), 'our food and beverages portfolio', 'Nestlé Health Science', 'Nestlé Skin Health', and 'the Board' as specific companies or internal units.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'society' and the 'global skincare market' as broader systems or societal contexts impacted by organizational actions.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] An organizational entity innovates and offers products, causally influencing individuals' health and diets, and contributing to broader society and markets.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph focuses on Nestlé (Organizational) as the central actor, whose innovations and products directly influence individuals' health and choices. Its actions are also explicitly aimed at contributing to society and competing within the global market (Environmental and Societal). While an explicit Inter-Organizational link was present ('joint venture Galderma formed the foundation of Nestlé Skin Health'), it was excluded to adhere to the protocol's limit of three distinct scales across all links, prioritizing the continuous and overarching interactions with individuals and societal systems.

Full Paragraph Text: We also announced new investments and research collaborations, which will enhance our ability to deliver sci ence-based solutions to improve the quality of people’s lives. A newly-announced research partnership with the EpiGen consortium will help us to better develop our understanding of the influence of nutrition and genetics at the beginning of life and continue to build our knowledge in this important area. The Nestlé Institute of Health Sciences began a collab oration on a groundbreaking project, which could one day lead to the development of made-to-measure vitamin com binations tailored to individual needs. Our company was founded almost 150 years ago on the product Henri Nestlé invented, farine lactée. It saved the life of a child. Today we continue to invest in science-based innovation to ensure we can answer current and future needs.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a company making investments, forming research partnerships, and developing products through its Institute of Health Sciences; Individual: People whose lives are improved by the science-based solutions, and individuals who would receive tailored vitamin combinations
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé's research investments and collaborations deliver science-based solutions to improve individual lives.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph clearly describes how Nestlé (organizational scale) through its research partnerships and investments causally influences individuals by developing solutions to improve their quality of life and creating personalized vitamin combinations. This represents a direct cross-scale interaction from organizational actions to individual outcomes.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Inter-Organizational / Sector: Research partnership with the EpiGen consortium; Organizational: Nestlé / Nestlé Institute of Health Sciences increasing capability and understanding; Individual: People’s lives and a child beneficiary of a product
gpt5: Summary: [Inter-Organizational / Sector, Organizational, Individual] A consortium partnership boosts the company’s understanding, and company solutions/products improve individuals’ lives.
gpt5: Rationale: Text states the EpiGen partnership helps the company develop understanding (cross-scale: inter-org to org). It also states company efforts and a product improve/save lives (org to individual). Speculative claims were excluded.

o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé's research collaborations aim to improve individual lives through science-based solutions.
o4_mini: Rationale: The link exists as the organizational efforts of Nestlé directly aim to enhance the quality of life for individuals, establishing a clear causal influence from the organizational scale to the individual scale.

gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to specific people or their needs, such as 'people’s lives', 'individual needs', and 'a child'.; Organizational: Refers to a single organization (e.g., 'Our company', 'We', 'Nestlé') or its formal internal units (e.g., 'Nestlé Institute of Health Sciences').; Inter-Organizational / Sector: Refers to collaborations or systems among organizations, explicitly mentioned as a 'research partnership with the EpiGen consortium'.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector] Organizational investments and inter-organizational partnerships explicitly lead to innovations that improve individuals' lives and address their specific needs.

These actions are directly stated to impact Individual well-being and needs. The identified three scales are clearly defined and demonstrate explicit causal influences, with multiple links highlighting the Organizational impact on Individual lives.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014 we held another successful Creating Shared Value forum, this time at the Nestlé Research Center in Lausanne, co-organised for the first time with a United Nations body, the UN Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD). The President of the Swiss Confederation used his address to the event to plead for water to become a self-standing goal of the future global development agenda. At the event we renewed our long-standing partnership with the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies. Since 2006 this collaboration has focused on the improvement of rural communities’ access to clean water and sanitation.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a single company hosting the forum and partnering with other organizations like the International Federation of Red Cross; Environmental and Societal: Rural communities receiving improved access to clean water and sanitation through the collaboration
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's partnership with Red Cross improves rural communities' water access.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear cross-scale interaction where organizational collaboration (Nestlé and Red Cross partnership) directly impacts societal-level outcomes (rural communities' access to clean water). The forum and government address are contextual but don't establish explicit causal links.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Individual: The President of the Swiss Confederation personally addressed the event.; Environmental and Societal: The future global development agenda is a societal-level policy framework.
gpt5: Summary: [Individual -> Environmental and Societal] The President’s address advocated adding a water goal to the global development agenda.
gpt5: Rationale: Explicit phrasing shows an individual’s advocacy aimed at shaping a societal-level agenda. Other mentions (partnership focus on improving access) indicate intent, not explicit realized cross-scale effects, so excluded.

The detected scales include Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector, and Environmental and Societal, with clear causal links established.

The first is an Individual (President of the Swiss Confederation) influencing an Environmental and Societal level actor (global development agenda). The second involves an Inter-Organizational collaboration (Nestlé and IFRC partnership) directly impacting Environmental and Societal actors (rural communities). Only these three distinct scales were involved in explicit causal links.

Full Paragraph Text: Currently, at the United Nations there are intense discussions about the global development goals for the period after 2015. At the same time, governments and international organ isations are increasingly reliant on the expertise, experience and resources of the private sector to help address some of the world’s most pressing problems. This offers an opportunity for global companies such as Nestlé to make a valu able contribution, in partnership with governments and civil society. We are participating actively in the policy dialogue in areas which will deeply influence our future business, such as food security, nutrition and health, water, sustainability, and human rights.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Governments and international organisations like the UN represent societal-level systems making policy decisions; Organizational: Nestlé as a specific global company participating in policy dialogue and contributing resources
claude4: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Governments increasingly rely on private sector expertise to address global problems.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes explicit reliance of governments/international organizations on private companies like Nestlé for resources and expertise. This creates a clear causal influence from societal-level actors to organizational actors, as the reliance drives companies to participate in policy dialogue.

gpt5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Policy dialogues, governments, and international organizations are societal-level systems shaping agendas.; Organizational: Nestlé (a global company) and its future business are at the single-organization level.
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Societal policy and public-sector reliance shape and create opportunities for Nestlé’s business.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states that societal policy dialogue will influence Nestlé’s future business and that public-sector reliance creates opportunities for the firm. To stay within scale limits, sector-level dynamics were not separately linked.

o4_mini: Rationale: The links are established through Nestlé's active participation in discussions that impact inter-organizational collaborations with governments and organizations, which in turn aim to tackle societal challenges. The detected scales include Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector, and Environmental and Societal, with clear causal links between them.

These links establish a reciprocal relationship between organizational and societal scales, mediated by the inter-organizational sector.

Full Paragraph Text: Nutrition, Health and Wellness is a priority for the people who buy our products, for society as a whole and for us as a busi ness. As the world’s leading food and beverage company we have a responsibility to use our knowledge and our research and development capability to make a positive difference to society. We have an important role to play in not only provid ing good nutrition but in helping people understand its value.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company ('us as a business', 'world's leading food and beverage company') taking responsibility and using capabilities; Environmental and Societal: Society as a whole and the people who buy products, representing broader societal systems
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Company uses R&D capabilities to make positive difference to society through nutrition.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear causal relationship where the company (Organizational) explicitly takes responsibility to influence society (Environmental and Societal) through its knowledge, R&D capabilities, and educational role in nutrition.

gpt5: Rationale: Explicit statements link the company’s actions to outcomes for society and for individuals. These are direct cross-scale influences; no inter-organizational or sector-level actors are mentioned.

Full Paragraph Text: Start Healthy Stay Healthy is our interactive, science-based education programme designed to help parents and care givers provide nutritionally and developmentally adequate nutrition in the crucial first 1000 days of life. We support and promote breastfeeding as the best start a baby can have in life. Our educational programmes are targeted at people who are most involved in implementing good practices during this important early period in a child’s development. We help to guide parents and caregivers to raise healthier children and help healthcare professionals have a greater impact on the nutritional aspects of care of future generations.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company/organization running the 'Start Healthy Stay Healthy' education programme that designs and delivers interventions; Individual: Parents, caregivers, and healthcare professionals who receive the educational programmes and implement nutritional practices
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Company's education programme helps parents and caregivers provide better nutrition for children.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear causal relationship where an organizational education programme explicitly influences individual behaviors of parents, caregivers, and healthcare professionals in providing nutritional care. The organization designs and delivers interventions that guide and help individuals implement better practices.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The 'Start Healthy Stay Healthy' education programme is a formal program run by an organization.; Individual: Parents, caregivers, and healthcare professionals are specific people acting on guidance.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] The programme guides parents/caregivers and enables healthcare professionals to improve nutrition-related practices.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states the programme influences individuals (parents, caregivers, healthcare professionals). Only Organizational and Individual scales are used, as effects remain at the personal practice level without broader system actors.

o4_mini: Rationale: The links show how the organizational effort of the education programme directly impacts individual behaviors of parents and caregivers, which in turn affects broader societal health outcomes. The focus on these three scales is due to their clear causal relationships in the text.

gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly describes the 'Start Healthy Stay Healthy' program (Organizational scale) providing direct assistance and guidance to 'parents and care givers' and 'healthcare professionals' (Individual scale). All causal interactions are focused on this upward influence from the Organizational level to the Individual level. No other scales were mentioned as actors or recipients of cross-scale causal influence, limiting the analysis to these two distinct scales.

Full Paragraph Text: We ensure global compliance with responsible advertising and marketing standards for children, abiding by external pledges such as the EU Pledge. At the end of 2014, the Ex ecutive Board approved an updated and strengthened Nestlé Marketing Communication to Children Policy, which will come into effect in December 2015. To ensure consistent and effective implementation, detailed internal guidelines have been developed and external stakeholders are encouraged to provide feedback via our Tell us reporting mechanism. We have phased out our marketing communication in schools and reinforced our health and wellness education activities, particularly those that positively impact children’s development and support governments’ goals to increase physical activity.
claude4: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a company implementing policies, developing guidelines, and conducting marketing activities; Environmental and Societal: External pledges like EU Pledge, governments setting goals for physical activity, and external stakeholders providing feedback
claude4: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] External pledges drive Nestlé's compliance policies while company activities support government goals.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph shows bidirectional causality between Nestlé (Organizational) and external regulatory/governmental systems (Environmental and Societal). External pledges explicitly drive compliance behavior, while company activities explicitly support government objectives.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Inter-Organizational / Sector: External pledges such as the EU Pledge are multi-organization commitments influencing members.; Organizational: Nestlé (and its Executive Board/policies) acts as a single organization.; Individual: Children whose development is impacted by the company’s education activities.
gpt5: Summary: [Inter-Organizational / Sector, Organizational, Individual] External pledges shape Nestlé’s policies, which in turn improve children’s development.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties external pledges to company behavior and states company activities positively impact children. A potential Organizational -> Environmental and Societal link (supporting governments’ goals) was omitted to keep within the three-scale limit.

o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's marketing policies aim to support children's development and align with government goals for physical activity.
o4_mini: Rationale: The links demonstrate how Nestlé's organizational policies are influenced by societal goals and, conversely, how these policies aim to impact societal outcomes. Both scales are essential for understanding the interactions.

gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Children are specific people whose development is explicitly stated to be impacted.; Organizational: Refers to Nestlé ('We'), its 'Executive Board', internal 'Policy' and 'guidelines', 'Tell us reporting mechanism', and 'education activities', as well as 'schools' as specific institutions.; Environmental and Societal: Includes 'external pledges' (e.g., EU Pledge, interpreted as societal norms/standards), 'external stakeholders' (representing broader community/public input), and 'governments' (societal-level systems).

Full Paragraph Text: By the end of 2014 the Nestlé Healthy Kids programme was in 73 countries, supporting initiatives which demonstrate how appropriate nutrition and exercise can improve the health of children and their communities. In addition, our own studies in four countries have shown that two thirds of children are insufficiently hydrated when they arrive at school. In 2014 we provided tools and information that schools, parents and caregivers need to ensure children learn about the benefits of healthy hydration.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a company implementing the Healthy Kids programme and conducting studies; Individual: Children, parents, caregivers, and schools as specific people and informal groups receiving tools and information
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé provides tools and information to schools, parents and caregivers for children's health education.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé (organizational scale) explicitly providing tools and information that causally enables schools, parents and caregivers (individual scale) to educate children about healthy hydration. This represents a clear cross-scale causal influence from organization to individuals.

gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states Nestlé provided tools/info needed by parents/caregivers and schools, enabling action. It also states schools ensure children learn, indicating organizational-to-individual influence. Other claims lack clear actors.

o4_mini: Rationale: The links show how Nestlé's initiatives directly affect children's health, which in turn impacts their communities. The scales are limited to Organizational, Individual, and Environmental and Societal due to the explicit causal relationships present.

These are single organizations or their specific programs/units.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to broader societal structures like 'communities'.

Another clear link is from Organizational (schools) to Individual (children). The three scales (Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal) cover all explicitly mentioned actors with cross-scale interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: United for Healthier Kids is a platform, created by Nestlé in 2014, where society can engage and collaborate to find ways to improve the health and wellness of children, from conception to the age of 12 years. In Mexico, a TV series was launched which supports and encourages five families looking to change their eating and lifestyle habits over six months. The platform has also been launched in the Philippines.

claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear causal relationship where Nestlé (organizational scale) created a platform that directly supports and encourages specific families (individual scale) to change their behaviors. This represents explicit cross-scale influence from company to households.

gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: 'Children' and 'five families' refer to specific people or informal groups.; Organizational: 'Nestlé' is a single company. The 'United for Healthier Kids' platform and the 'TV series' are programs/initiatives created and launched by Nestlé, thus belonging to the Organizational scale.; Environmental and Societal: 'Society' refers to a broad societal-level system or community, distinct from a single organization or individual.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal, Individual] Nestlé's platform enables societal engagement to improve children's health, and its TV series directly supports families to change habits.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly describes three cross-scale interactions. The Nestlé-created platform (Organizational) facilitates 'society' (Environmental and Societal) engagement. This societal engagement, in turn, aims to improve the health of 'children' (Individual). Separately, a TV series launched by the initiative (Organizational) directly 'supports and encourages' 'five families' (Individual) in behavioral change. The Organizational -> Individual link (TV series to families) is identified as the most critical due to its direct and explicit intervention targeting individual behavioral change.

Full Paragraph Text: Through innovation and renovation we continue to make our products tastier and healthier. In line with the recommendations from public health authorities, we are reducing the amount of salt, sugar and saturated fats in our products as part of our contribution towards the fight against non-communicable diseases in society. Our reduction targets are in cluded in our public nutrition commitments (detailed in the Nestlé in society report) so our progress can be measured. We are also ensuring that whole grains are the primary ingredient in our breakfast cereals for children and teenagers.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Public health authorities represent societal-level institutions that provide recommendations and guidance; Organizational: The company (Nestlé) is making specific product changes and commitments in response to these recommendations
claude4: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Public health recommendations drive company to reformulate products with less salt, sugar and fats.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph clearly shows public health authorities (societal-level actors) influencing organizational behavior through recommendations that the company explicitly follows in reformulating their products.
gpt5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company ('we') sets product reformulation targets and commitments.; Environmental and Societal: Public health authorities and the societal fight against NCDs.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Public health guidance drives company reformulation, which the company says contributes to society’s fight against NCDs.
gpt5: Rationale: Public health authorities (societal) explicitly prompt the company (organizational) to reduce salt, sugar, and fats. The company states these reductions contribute to society’s fight against NCDs. Other elements are intra-organizational or not cross-scale.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé is making specific product changes based on health recommendations.; Environmental and Societal: Public health authorities influence societal health outcomes.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's product innovations are influenced by public health recommendations to improve societal health outcomes.
o4_mini: Rationale: The link exists because Nestlé's organizational actions are directly influenced by the recommendations from public health authorities, which aim to address societal health issues. No other distinct scales were present.
gemini2.5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal | Organizational -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'children and teenagers' as specific groups of people benefiting from product changes.; Organizational: Refers to 'we' (the company, Nestlé) carrying out actions, making products, and setting targets.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'public health authorities' issuing recommendations and 'society' dealing with non-communicable diseases.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational, Individual] Public health recommendations guide organizational product changes that benefit both societal health and individual consumers.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The text explicitly details how public health authorities (Environmental and Societal) influence the company's (Organizational) product formulation decisions ('in line with'). These organizational actions then serve as a 'contribution towards' addressing non-communicable diseases at the societal level (Environmental and Societal). Furthermore, the company's actions directly benefit individuals ('for children and teenagers'). All three scales are clearly identified with explicit causal language.

Full Paragraph Text: We want to help people who buy our products to make informed decisions by giving them better nutritional information on our product labels. We are enhancing our portion guidance and have committed to print GDAs (Guideline Daily Amounts) on the front of all relevant packaging. These make it easier for people to see how much salt, sugar or fat is in the product, and how the amounts compare to reference daily guidelines. Nestlé Portion Guidance is a voluntary initiative
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a company implementing portion guidance initiatives and committing to enhanced product labeling; Individual: People who buy products and make informed decisions based on nutritional information
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé enhances product labeling to help customers make informed purchasing decisions.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear causal relationship where Nestlé (organizational scale) implements labeling changes that directly influence individual consumers' ability to make informed decisions. The company's voluntary initiative of printing nutritional information is explicitly designed to affect individual behavior.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé (the company) commits to print GDAs and enhance portion guidance.; Individual: People who buy the products and use labels to make informed decisions.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé’s labeling changes make it easier for buyers to assess nutrition and decide.
gpt5: Rationale: The company’s labeling action explicitly enables consumers to understand nutrition and make decisions. No other cross-scale causality is stated (e.g., societal guidelines do not cause Nestlé’s actions).
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Individual: Consumers are the individuals making decisions based on the nutritional information.; Organizational: Nestlé is the organization providing the nutritional information through its product labels.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé's initiative to improve product labeling influences consumer decisions regarding nutrition.
o4_mini: Rationale: The link exists because Nestlé's actions in enhancing nutritional information on product labels directly affect how individuals make informed decisions about their purchases.
gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Individual | Environmental and Societal -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'people who buy our products' and 'people' as consumers who make decisions or understand information.; Organizational: Refers to 'We' (representing Nestlé), its 'portion guidance' initiative, and actions like 'giving information' and 'committed to print GDAs'.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'GDAs (Guideline Daily Amounts)' and 'reference daily guidelines' as established societal standards or norms.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Organizational actions and societal guidelines both influence individual decision-making by providing nutritional information.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The analysis identified two explicit cross-scale causal links. The Organizational actor (Nestlé) directly influences individuals by providing nutritional information. Additionally, the Environmental and Societal guidelines (GDAs), once communicated by the organization, make it easier for individuals to understand product contents. These three distinct scales (Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal) were explicitly involved, meeting the specified limit.

Full Paragraph Text: In parts of the world where people find it difficult to get essential vitamins and minerals in their daily diets, we fortify foods to help them and their families stay healthy. We are on track to deliver our commitment of 200 billion servings of micronutrient fortified foods and beverages annually around the world by next year. In 2014 we continued to extend the reach of our microfortification programmes, focusing on categories for children and women of child-bearing age, such as fortified infant cereals and growing-up milks.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company ('we') implementing microfortification programmes and delivering fortified foods globally; Individual: People, families, children, and women of child-bearing age who receive and consume the fortified foods
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Company fortifies foods to help people and families stay healthy through micronutrient programmes.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear causal relationship where an organizational actor (the company) takes specific actions (fortifying foods, extending microfortification programmes) that directly benefit individual actors (people, families, children, women). The company explicitly states they fortify foods 'to help them and their families stay healthy,' establishing clear cross-scale causality from organizational policy to individual health outcomes.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: “We” refers to a specific organization running fortification programs and commitments.; Individual: “People,” “their families,” “children,” and “women of child-bearing age” are individual beneficiaries.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] The organization fortifies foods and expands programs to help individuals, including children and women, stay healthy.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties the organization’s fortification programs to improved health outcomes for individuals. No inter-organizational or societal actors are causally implicated, so only Org -> Individual is included.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to people and families receiving fortified foods.; Organizational: Refers to the organization implementing microfortification programmes.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] The organization fortifies foods to improve health for individuals and families in need of essential nutrients.
o4_mini: Rationale: The link exists as the organizational action of fortifying foods directly influences the health of individuals and families. No other distinct scales were present.

gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states a direct causal link: 'We' (Organizational) fortify foods 'to help them and their families stay healthy' (Individual). This establishes a clear influence from the actions of a company to the well-being of individuals. Only two scales were identified with an explicit cross-scale causal link.

Full Paragraph Text: Our expertise in beverage systems ensured a good response from consumers in North America to Nespresso’s new VertuoLine system. By the end of 2014, Nescafé Dolce Gusto, the fastest growing coffee system business in the world, was being sold in more than 70 countries. In Japan we started using humanoid robots to sell Nescafé Dolce Gusto and Nescafé Gold Blend Barista coffee machines.

Full Paragraph Text: We market our breast-milk substitutes in line with the aims and principles of the World Health Organization’s International Code of Marketing of Breast-Milk Substitutes as imple mented by governments. Our marketing standards are the strictest in the industry. We are the only breast-milk substitute manufacturer to be included in the FTSE4Good responsible investment index (see the Nestlé in society report).
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a company implementing marketing standards and being included in investment index; Environmental and Societal: WHO International Code and government implementations represent societal-level regulatory frameworks
claude4: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] WHO Code and government regulations guide company's breast-milk substitute marketing practices.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph shows clear causality where societal-level regulatory frameworks (WHO Code implemented by governments) directly influence organizational behavior (company's marketing practices). The company explicitly states they market 'in line with' these external standards, demonstrating regulatory influence on corporate conduct.

gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties the WHO Code to government implementation and the firm’s marketing aligning with that implementation. This yields a chain WHO (org) -> governments (env/soc) -> company (org). No other explicit cross-scale causality is stated.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé’s Jian Xin Double Care, a specially designed milk to enhance heart and bone health for middle-aged and senior adults, was launched in China in December 2013. The product contains phytosterols, which lower LDL (‘bad’) cholesterol, as well as calcium and vitamin D. The brand raises awareness of heart health with in-store health checks and offers toll-free phone contact with doctors to discuss cardiovascular health.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014, we transformed a dairy factory in Mexico into the company’s first ‘zero water’ manufacturing site in the world. Cow’s milk is 88% water, so by extracting some of it to use in the factory’s systems, we are saving enough water to meet the average daily consumption of 6400 people in the surrounding area.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company that transformed the dairy factory and implemented the zero water manufacturing system; Environmental and Societal: The surrounding area community of 6400 people whose daily water consumption needs are being met through the water savings
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Company's zero water factory saves water equivalent to daily needs of 6400 local residents.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear causal relationship where an organizational action (transforming the factory) directly benefits the broader community by conserving water resources. Only two scales are involved, making this a straightforward cross-scale interaction.

gpt5: Rationale: The company’s change to a zero-water manufacturing process explicitly causes water savings benefiting individuals. No other cross-scale causal effects are stated.

gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that the company's (Organizational scale) action of saving water directly influences the water consumption of people (Individual scale). No other cross-scale interactions are mentioned, as the transformation of the factory and water extraction processes are internal to the Organizational scale, and their impact on individuals is the only explicit cross-scale effect.

Full Paragraph Text: The successful roll-out of Maggi Oats Noodles demonstrated that healthy eating can be both enjoyable and tasty. Strong sales of the new product show that it is also good business. Maggi Oats Noodles meet Nestlé Nutritional Foundation criteria, which are based on public health recommendations. The consumer communication reinforces the importance for families to start the day with a well-balanced breakfast, including fruits and milk. In 2014, we continued to renovate Maggi products all around the world, reducing salt and fat and improving their nutritional benefits.

Full Paragraph Text: The Maggi company began selling powdered soups in Switzerland in 1885. Julius Maggi had pioneered the production of pea and bean soups at the request of the Swiss Public Welfare Society to address the dietary deficiency of the work ing population. The advent of factory work for women meant less time to prepare food, and the soups were a convenient and nourishing alternative.
claude4: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Individual
claude4: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Swiss Public Welfare Society represents a societal-level organization addressing population-wide issues; Organizational: Maggi company as a specific business entity developing and selling products; Individual: Working women and the working population as specific people affected by factory work conditions

claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear chain where a societal organization requests corporate action, which then serves individual workers. Two separate cross-scale links capture this: society influencing company, and company serving individuals.

gpt5: Rationale: Explicit causality links a societal labor shift to reduced individual cooking time. Other plausible org-to-individual influences are present but would add a third scale, so the clearest cross-scale link was prioritized.

Full Paragraph Text: Our performance in North America was affected by the frozen category. Projects are underway to reposition Lean Cuisine, Hot Pockets and Stouffers. They address all elements of the marketing mix, reflecting trends such as organic and ethnic, enhancing the brands’ relevance to consumers. We are taking the same approach in frozen pizza where our California Pizza Kitchen did well. In ice cream the super premium segment performed well with Gelato, and snacks returned to growth, although the premium segment was subdued. In confectionery the successful roll-out of Butterfinger Peanut Butter Cups continued. Innovations like Natural Bliss and seasonal renovations of flavours helped Coffee-mate de liver good growth. Innovation also ensured the petcare busi ness in North America continued to grow with Dog Chow, Pro Plan and Tidy Cats Lightweight cat litter as highlights. The launch of Beyond natural pet food gained momentum.

This represents a direct cross-scale interaction from company strategy to consumer response.

Full Paragraph Text: Latin America delivered good organic growth despite a worsening of the macroeconomic situation towards the end of the year. Although consumer sentiment varied across the region, most markets did well. All Brazil’s categories grew, with Ninho in growing-up milks, KitKat in confectionery, Nesfit in biscuits and Nescau in cocoa and malt beverages making strong contributions. In Mexico the changes in fiscal legislation, pricing and subdued consumer demand affect ed the market. Nescafé Dolce Gusto delivered double-digit growth across the region, while Dog Chow and Pro Plan drove sales in the petcare business.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Macroeconomic situation, consumer sentiment, consumer demand, and fiscal legislation represent societal-level economic and regulatory systems; Organizational: Nestlé as a company with specific brands (Ninho, KitKat, Nesfit, etc.) and business performance across markets
claude4: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Macroeconomic conditions and fiscal changes affected company market performance across Latin America.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes how societal-level factors (macroeconomic situation, consumer sentiment, fiscal legislation, consumer demand) explicitly influenced organizational performance. The company's brand performance is presented as responding to these external pressures, particularly in Mexico where fiscal and demand changes 'affected the market.'

gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states that fiscal legislation changes affected the market, a cross-scale causal link from societal policy to sector dynamics. Other statements describe performance contributions or demand/pricing without clear cross-scale causality, so they were excluded.

While Environmental and Societal factors like macroeconomic situation and fiscal legislation are mentioned, their stated causal effects are on other Environmental and Societal elements (e.g., market), thus not qualifying as cross-scale in this context. Only two distinct scales were involved in the extracted causal links, well within the limit.

Full Paragraph Text: Good performances in France, Switzerland, Austria and the Netherlands, and a recovery in Spain and Portugal sup ported the growth in Western Europe. The Great Britain region, Germany, Italy and Greece were more challenged. There were strong performances from petcare and Nescafé Dolce Gusto across Western Europe and we saw good growth from innovations in several categories. Highlights included Nescafé Gold and Azzera premium soluble coffee, Fresh Up and Buitoni Fiesta in frozen pizza, Maggi snacking noodles in ambient culinary and the launch of premium chocolate tablets Les Recettes de l’Atelier in France.

Full Paragraph Text: The slower growth in the Zone was due to our largest market China and to Oceania. In China we needed to adapt our portfolio to reconnect with the fast-changing expectations of the Chinese consumer. Therefore, in addition to correcting trade stocks throughout the year, we focused on innovation, on reformulation and on re-launches, particularly in coffee, ready-to-drink and confectionery. We continued to see good performances in ambient culinary, ice cream and ready-to drink coffee. In Oceania we are focused on developing new trade channels.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Individual: Chinese consumers with fast-changing expectations who influence company decisions; Organizational: The company that adapts its portfolio, focuses on innovation, and develops new trade channels in response
claude4: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Chinese consumer expectations drive company portfolio adaptation and innovation focus.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states the company needed to adapt its portfolio to reconnect with fast-changing Chinese consumer expectations, showing clear causality from individual consumers to organizational strategy changes.

Limiting to three scales provided the clearest and most explicit causal links.

Full Paragraph Text: The volatile currency environment made our review of the Group’s treasury operations particularly pertinent. The Boards also spent time assessing the quality of talent management and Unilever’s competitive environment. Broad exposure to senior managers in 2014 allowed the Directors to gain a deeper understanding of the business and helped in the wider strategy discussions.

claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes how individual Directors gained understanding through exposure to senior managers, which then causally influenced organizational-level strategy discussions. This represents a clear cross-scale interaction from individual learning to organizational decision-making.

A possible Individual -> Organizational link (senior manager exposure aiding strategy discussions) was excluded to keep total scales within the required limit and prioritize the clearest causal statement.

Full Paragraph Text: Even though we have made significant strides over recent years in improving our organisational agility and our ability to respond quickly to events, there is still room for improvement. I would like to have seen us react a little quicker, for example, to the slowdown in a number of markets, particularly China, where frankly we were caught off-guard by the speed and scale of weakening consumer demand. In terms of our categories, all of them contributed – albeit in different ways – to the overall performance of the Group and I have confidence in the strength and long-term growth potential of our portfolio.

Full Paragraph Text: We also made progress in our commitment to serve a wider group of stakeholders through the USLP and our Vision of growing the business while reducing our environmental footprint and increasing our positive social impact, not only in that part of the business under our direct control but throughout the whole value chain. This manifests itself in many different ways – everything from playing our part in putting an end to deforestation to ensuring we embrace and advance human rights principles throughout the length of our supply chain. You can see a number of examples set out in other parts of this report.

This represents a clear cross-scale interaction where organizational policy drives sector-wide change.

The focus on the value chain limits the scales to Organizational and Inter-Organizational / Sector, as they are directly connected.

This extension implies the organization influences the inter-organizational system (Organizational -> Inter-Organizational), which in turn is where the environmental and social impacts manifest (Inter-Organizational -> Environmental and Societal). Three distinct scales were identified, adhering to the specified limit.

Full Paragraph Text: A fundamental requirement at Unilever is to understand our consumers. We use focus groups and quantitative studies and spend time with consumers in stores and in their homes to find out what is important to them – as citizens as well as consumers – so we can create products they need and want. Unilever carelines are also a rich source of information. Digital communications and social media mean we can engage with large numbers of people consistently over long periods of time so we can immerse ourselves in their day-to-day lives. We can use online search data to identify and anticipate future consumer trends and gain a competitive edge.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Individual: Consumers, citizens, and people who participate in focus groups, provide feedback through carelines, and engage on social media; Organizational: Unilever as a company conducting research, creating products, and using digital communications to engage with consumers
claude4: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Consumer feedback and engagement enables Unilever to understand needs and create desired products.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear causal relationship where individual consumers influence Unilever's organizational decisions through various feedback mechanisms. Consumers provide information that directly shapes the company's product development and strategy.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Digital communications, social media, and online search data are societal-level systems.; Organizational: Unilever is a single company making product and engagement decisions.
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Societal digital platforms enable Unilever to engage extensively with consumers.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states that digital communications and social media enable Unilever to engage with many people, a cross-scale causal effect. Other statements (e.g., carelines, methods) are same-scale or less explicit.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Individual: Consumers are specific people whose needs and preferences are being studied.; Organizational: Unilever is a single organization conducting research and product development.
o4_mini: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Unilever's understanding of consumers influences its product development.

gemini2.5: Final Link: Individual -> Organizational (online search data for trends)

gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly details how Unilever (Organizational) actively gathers information from and engages with consumers (Individual). This bidirectional interaction involves Unilever understanding consumers, and consumers' needs and data influencing Unilever's product creation, communication strategies, and trend identification. All identified links are cross-scale between these two levels, supporting a continuous feedback loop. No other scales were mentioned or implied.

Full Paragraph Text: The big development for 2014 has been the launch of our Partner To Win 2020 programme to create a supplier ecosystem where partners work with us and each other to create breakthroughs in products or packaging to deliver the capacity, innovation and sustainable solutions to meet our growth ambition. A great example is the new Dove Body Wash bottle using 15% less plastic (see inside front cover).

Full Paragraph Text: That knowledge helps us to target our subsequent R&D activities and our investments in innovation. Unilever has filed more than 200 new patent applications in 2014 and our Partner To Win 2020 programme, also launched in 2014, creates a new platform for us to work with our suppliers in the development of product and packaging innovations that capture consumers’ interest and attention.

Full Paragraph Text: Unilever itself manufactures the majority of its products and we maintain an international network of 240 manufacturing sites. In sourcing large amounts of raw materials we also have a direct impact on the environment. By sourcing sustainably, we can protect scarce resources, ensure security of supply for our business and reduce price volatility while protecting the environment and enhancing people’s lives, which is at the heart of our Unilever Sustainable Living Plan (USLP). More detail can be found on page 11.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever as a single company with manufacturing sites and sourcing decisions; Environmental and Societal: The environment that is directly impacted by Unilever's sourcing and manufacturing activities
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Unilever's raw material sourcing directly impacts the environment.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that Unilever's sourcing activities have a direct impact on the environment, establishing clear causality from organizational actions to environmental outcomes. Only two scales are involved, making this a straightforward cross-scale interaction.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever as a company taking sourcing and manufacturing actions.; Environmental and Societal: The environment, scarce resources, price volatility, and people’s lives.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Unilever’s sourcing directly impacts the environment and broader societal outcomes.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states Unilever’s sourcing has a direct environmental impact and claims broader societal benefits. Other outcomes (e.g., security of supply) are organizational-level, so only this cross-scale link is included.

Furthermore, sustainable sourcing is stated to directly enhance people's lives (Individual). All identified links are explicit cross-scale interactions. No more than 3 distinct scales are involved.

Full Paragraph Text: Our logistics operations move Unilever products to retailers and our go-to-market teams ensure that we get enough of the right products in the right price bracket in the right sales channels for consumers to buy, be they stores or the fast-growing e-commerce channel.

claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes how Unilever's internal teams (organizational scale) explicitly work to enable consumer purchases (individual scale). Full Paragraph Text: We make the majority of what we sell through a network of more than 240 manufacturing sites around the world. We have invested significantly in our factories in recent years to create an efficient, reliable and more sustainable network. We are now able to maximise the global scale of our operations, while having the agility to meet local demands. More eco-efficient production is helping us meet the USLP targets, so by the end of January 2015, for instance, all our factories had achieved zero non-hazardous waste to landfill, producing 140,000 tonnes less waste. Since 2008, we estimate that eco-production has avoided costs in excess of €400 million.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company ('We') as a single entity making investments, setting targets, and implementing eco-efficient production practices; Inter-Organizational / Sector: The network of more than 240 manufacturing sites around the world represents a multi-organizational manufacturing system

The causality is explicit through the investment-outcome relationship.

Full Paragraph Text: How we move products from factories to customers is the role of our logistics operation. We are now rolling out our global network of logistics centres that organise movement of goods centrally and more efficiently, delivering savings, reduced stocks, reduced carbon emissions and improved customer service. These operational hubs now allow us to centralise other services too, including monitoring orders from customers through to payment.

Full Paragraph Text: We work closely with retailers to win in the market place and make sure that our brands are always available, properly displayed and in the right price bracket. Our go-to-market capability ensures that we become the supplier of choice for our customers and trade partners, through strong joint business planning and in-store execution via Perfect Store programmes, to help deliver sustainable sales growth. This is essential for us to be able to add premium brand extensions to our product ranges, land product innovations on the shelves, enter new geographies and markets, and build our distribution strength to reach new consumers.

Full Paragraph Text: We spend about €7 billion annually on marketing, making us one of the world’s biggest advertisers. This ensures that our brands and products are consumers’ first choice. We use multiple media to achieve cut-through in a highly competitive and busy world. Traditional media channels continue to play a big part but digital communications have revolutionised the way marketing engages with people, creating entirely new sales and marketing opportunities. We create our own entertainment content, including Unilever brand advertising, and this is distributed, for example, by mobile devices in emerging markets.

The company states this marketing 'ensures that our brands and products are consumers' first choice,' establishing clear cross-scale causality from organizational action to individual behavior.

Full Paragraph Text: We are making good progress with our first goal: to help more than a billion people improve their health and well-being by 2020, reaching 397 million by the end of 2014. The progress on our second goal is more mixed. We have achieved zero non-hazardous waste to landfill from our factories, and continue to make significant reductions in the greenhouse gas (GHG) and water impacts of our manufacturing. But the consumer element of our target to halve the water and GHG impacts of our products remains a challenge. On waste reduction, new technology such as the roll-out of compressed deodorant sprays and our new Dove Body Wash bottles has enabled reductions. On our third goal, we are also making good progress. We are now sourcing more than half our agricultural raw materials sustainably and have reached around 800,000 smallholder farmers with help and training. We have created 70,000 women micro-entrepreneurs distributing our products in India while making progress on our new commitments to enhance livelihoods across the value chain.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Individual: Smallholder farmers receiving help and training, women micro-entrepreneurs distributing products, and consumers using products; Organizational: The company implementing sustainability goals, manufacturing changes, and sourcing policies
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Company reaches smallholder farmers with training and creates women micro-entrepreneurs for product distribution.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes explicit organizational actions that directly impact individuals - providing help and training to farmers, and creating micro-entrepreneur opportunities for women. These represent clear cross-scale causality from organizational initiatives to individual outcomes.

o4_mini: Rationale: The links are drawn from the organization's actions that directly influence individual actors, such as smallholder farmers and women micro-entrepreneurs. The focus is on these two scales as they represent clear causal relationships.

gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to specific people (billion people, smallholder farmers, women micro-entrepreneurs) or informal groups (consumer element).; Organizational: Refers to 'We' (the company), its internal units (factories, manufacturing), and its products and technology.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: Refers to the 'value chain', which encompasses systems and collaborations among multiple organizations.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Organizational] The organization actively helps individuals, supports smallholder farmers, creates entrepreneurs, and enhances value chain livelihoods, though consumer behavior presents challenges.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly details how the Organizational entity ('We') exerts causal influence on Individual actors (people, farmers, entrepreneurs) through direct help, training, and creation. It also shows a causal influence on the Inter-Organizational / Sector level by 'enhancing livelihoods across the value chain'. Conversely, the 'consumer element' (Individual scale) is identified as a challenge to the Organizational target, indicating a causal impediment. These interactions clearly span three distinct hierarchical scales.

Full Paragraph Text: Some of the largest FMCG companies, along with Unilever, include: Nestlé, Procter & Gamble, L’Oréal, Danone, Kraft Foods and Colgate-Palmolive. All have identified emerging markets as a major growth opportunity in years to come.
claude4: Scale Explanations: N/A
claude4: Summary: N/A

There is no explicit causal influence described between different scales - just companies recognizing growth potential in emerging markets without any cross-scale interaction being stated.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A

o4_mini: Summary: N/A

gemini2.5: Summary: N/A

However, the text only states that companies 'have identified' these markets as opportunities. It does not describe an explicit causal influence from the markets to the companies, nor from the companies' identification to the markets. The phrasing describes an internal strategic assessment by the companies, not a stated causal interaction between the two distinct scales.

o4_mini: Scale Explanations: N/A

gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: N/A

Full Paragraph Text: Cultivation of commodities such as palm oil has contributed to deforestation which has been a major factor behind climate change. This in turn has reduced the availability of raw materials, increasing their price and FMCG production costs.
claude4: Links: Inter-Organizational / Sector -> Environmental and Societal | Environmental and Societal -> Inter-Organizational / Sector
claude4: Scale Explanations: Inter-Organizational / Sector: FMCG production represents industrial sector activities involving multiple organizations in commodity supply chains; Environmental and Societal: Climate change and deforestation represent large-scale environmental systems that affect societal conditions
claude4: Summary: [Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal] Palm oil cultivation causes deforestation and climate change, which increases FMCG production costs.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear bidirectional relationship between sector-level commodity cultivation and environmental systems. First, industrial palm oil cultivation causes environmental damage. Then, the resulting climate change creates feedback effects that increase costs for the same industrial sector.
gpt5: Scales: Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal, Organizational
gpt5: Links: Inter-Organizational / Sector -> Environmental and Societal | Environmental and Societal -> Organizational
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Inter-Organizational / Sector: Commodity cultivation (e.g., palm oil) denotes sector-level production activity.; Environmental and Societal: Deforestation and climate change are environmental/societal outcomes.; Organizational: FMCG producers are organizations incurring production costs.
gpt5: Summary: [Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Sectoral commodity cultivation drives environmental change, which then raises FMCG firms’ production costs.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links sectoral cultivation to environmental impacts, and then links those impacts to firm-level cost increases. These two cross-scale causal steps form a chain, so both pairwise links are reported.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Deforestation and climate change are societal-level issues.; Organizational: FMCG (Fast-Moving Consumer Goods) companies are organizations affected by these changes.
o4_mini: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Deforestation and climate change affect FMCG production costs.
o4_mini: Rationale: The link between environmental issues and organizational impacts is clear, as climate change directly influences the costs faced by FMCG companies due to raw material scarcity.
gemini2.5: Scales: Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal, Organizational
gemini2.5: Links: Inter-Organizational / Sector -> Environmental and Societal | Environmental and Societal -> Inter-Organizational / Sector | Inter-Organizational / Sector -> Organizational
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Inter-Organizational / Sector: Refers to commodity cultivation (an industry/sector activity), raw material availability, and market prices affecting supply chains.; Environmental and Societal: Represents deforestation and climate change as broad environmental phenomena and systems.; Organizational: Refers to FMCG production costs, which are incurred by individual companies.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Industry cultivation contributes to deforestation and climate change, which reduces raw material availability and increases prices, raising FMCG production costs.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly details a chain of cross-scale impacts. Inter-Organizational commodity cultivation causes Environmental and Societal deforestation and climate change. Climate change then affects Inter-Organizational raw material availability and prices, ultimately increasing Organizational FMCG production costs. Three distinct scales are clearly involved and linked.

Full Paragraph Text: FMCG product development is also reacting to consumers’ concerns about their own health and well-being.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Individual: Consumers represent individual-scale actors with health and well-being concerns; Organizational: FMCG product development represents organizational-scale activities within companies
claude4: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Consumer health concerns drive FMCG companies to adapt product development.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph clearly states that FMCG product development is 'reacting to' consumers' health concerns, establishing explicit causality from individual consumers to organizational product development activities.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Consumers are specific people whose concerns are cited.; Organizational: FMCG product development refers to company teams/functions adjusting products.
gpt5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Consumers’ health concerns cause FMCG product development teams to react.
gpt5: Rationale: The sentence explicitly ties consumers’ concerns to actions by product development, indicating causality. This is a cross-scale link from individuals to organizational teams; no other scales are mentioned.
